oai_dc:dc.dc:title: "Candles Glow At Nurses' Capping Ceremony"
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: medicine; nursing; war; women; 1930s;
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: "Eerie lights from candles played on the walls of a darkened assembly hall last night as Memphians witnessed the first public capping ceremony of nurses. Being capped by Miss Mary W. White, superintendent of nurses at Methodist Hospital, is Miss Almeria Owens, of Paragould, Ark., as other nurses look on."
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Day
